intro: Siler montanum subsp. montanum, commonly known as mountain siler, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Siler montanum subsp. montanum is typically perennial and has a compact growth habit, making it well adapted to harsh mountain environments.
